intro: Pseudolysimachion spicatum subsp. lanisepalum, commonly known as the broad-sepal piper, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Piperaceae family, which includes various species of pepper plants. The plant is characterized by its elongated, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered greenish-white flowers. Its subsp. lanisepalum distinguishes itself with broader sepals compared to other subspecies. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests.
